Articles.Content:
Bill falls to his death but glitches out on Jool!

Jebediah starts a new Minmus base!

Slingshot away from Kerbin.

Houston, we have a problem.

Landing zone in sight, and touchdown.

Next up, Eve.

Eve's weird atmosphere, like some kinda aurora borealis or something.

A previous attempt with bad staging. That will teach me..

Slingshot away from Kerbin.

Houston, we have a problem.

Landing zone in sight, and touchdown.

Next up, Eve.

Eve's weird atmosphere, like some kinda aurora borealis or something.

A previous attempt with bad staging. That will teach me..

Jool was as close as i got to landing on a new planet, as mechjeb doesnt work right and i am working on new rockets.

I'm loving the new patch. The only real downside is that now that there are so many interplanetary destinations, warp 100,000 isn't really fast enough. 1 second = 1.25 days is great for moons, but when you're waiting for an orbital encounter and the orbits take a year or two each, it's pretty tedious.

Anyone know of an addon that offers an increased warp?

Here are some pictures I took of Jool and two of its satellites. Unfortunately I wound up in a retrograde orbit around the planet (need to pay better attention next time) so getting into orbit around the moons was challenging, so say the least. I wound up running out of fuel while trying to gravity brake repeatedly to slow the ship. I did have a few close passes with two of the moons though, and I definitely hope that a warp factor 1 million is in the works.

The ship I took - The Kerbol Explorer. It's ugly. Really really ugly. And poorly designed. But it got me there.

Tylo appears to be a simple, rocky world. I didn't get close enough to find out whether it has an atmosphere or not.

Happening upon Laythe was a lucky break. I had run out of fuel and the gravity brake I was doing off of Tylo wound up sending me to Laythe. That said, Bill Kermin's final resting place is on Laythe's surface. Or perhaps a few yards under it. Laythe does have an atmosphere, it starts at around 50,000m give or take 5,000.

Edited September 21, 2012 by Jason Patterson
spoiler tags don't like apostrophes
both awesome pictures, but I am going to stick to minmus and the mun until a mod comes out that will help us get to planets faster.
here we have a nice shot of the Dunian horizon featuring the setting of....you guessed it, Duna itself (no photo editing programs were used in the making of this)

Here we can see my largest lander on the surface of Duna, was equipped with 3 stock parachutes on the 3 boosters and 1 large 3 parachute attachment on the top of the capsule that was ripped off and helped slow me down the most. I must say landing on Duna was the most intense thing i have done in KSP VERY satisfying.

Here we go! To Duna and back, using two vehicles.

http://imgur.com/a/shA8U
